title.original: A Hamlet For A Slothful Vassal
title.spanish: Una aldea para un vasallo perezoso

sections.original: Behold a jocund morn indeed! -
sections.spanish: ¡Contempla una mañana jubilosa, en verdad! –

sections.original: Sun on high - birds in sky.
sections.spanish: Sol en lo alto – aves en el cielo.

sections.original: Yonder the whist firth eathing,
sections.spanish: Allí, el estrecho silba devorando,

sections.original: Fro where a gale erranteth.
sections.spanish: De donde una ráfaga errante surge.

sections.original: Ye beholdest but the shadow.
sections.spanish: Sólo contempláis la sombra.

sections.original: That is a lie!
sections.spanish: ¡Eso es una mentira!

sections.original: Mayhap a tithe of trothplight -
sections.spanish: Tal vez una décima parte de la fidelidad –

sections.original: Lief I am not!
sections.spanish: ¡Pues no me place serlo!

sections.original: I deem - e'er and anon!
sections.spanish: Opino – una y otra vez!

sections.original: My words are but a twist.
sections.spanish: Mis palabras son sólo una trampa.

sections.original: Tis a feigned lie through loathing,
sections.spanish: Es una mentira fingida por desdén,

sections.original: I say!
sections.spanish: ¡digo!

sections.original: To and fro, save hither,
sections.spanish: De un lado a otro, salvo hacia aquí,

sections.original: Is thy love.
sections.spanish: está tu amor.

sections.original: A dotard gaffer, I daresay...
sections.spanish: Un viejo chocho, diría yo...

sections.original: Not a loth! -
sections.spanish: ¡En absoluto reacio! –

sections.original: But vying for my kinsmen!
sections.spanish: ¡Sino compitiendo contra mis parientes!

sections.original: ...a sapling not!
sections.spanish: …¡no un retoño!

sections.original: Beautiful tyrant!
sections.spanish: ¡Hermoso tirano!

sections.original: Fiend angelical!
sections.spanish: ¡Demonio angelical!

sections.original: Dove-feathered raven!
sections.spanish: ¡Cuervo emplumado de paloma!

sections.original: Wolvish-ravening lamb!
sections.spanish: ¡Cordero feroz como lobo!

sections.original: A hamlet for a slothful vassal -
sections.spanish: Una aldea para un vasallo perezoso –

sections.original: Soothing ale for a parched sot.
sections.spanish: Cerveza reconfortante para un borracho reseco.

sections.original: Hie to tell me
sections.spanish: Corre a decirme

sections.original: What ye judgest as naught;
sections.spanish: lo que juzgáis insignificante;

sections.original: I behold the shadow!
sections.spanish: ¡Yo contemplo la sombra!

sections.original: Wherefore call me such names;
sections.spanish: ¿Por qué me llamáis así?;

sections.original: Nay imp am I!
sections.spanish: ¡No, soy un diablillo!

sections.original: Thou art my aghast hart -
sections.spanish: Eres mi ciervo atónito –

sections.original: Grazing in the glade.
sections.spanish: pastoreando en el claro.

sections.original: E'er thou sayest aye!
sections.spanish: ¡Antes de que digas que sí!

sections.original: That is a lie!
sections.spanish: ¡Eso es una mentira!

sections.original: Thief of a plot!
sections.spanish: ¡Ladrón de un complot!

sections.original: Lief I am not!
sections.spanish: ¡No me place serlo!

sections.original: Now go to thy tryst!
sections.spanish: ¡Ahora ve a tu cita!

sections.original: My words are but a twist!
sections.spanish: ¡Mis palabras son sólo una trampa!

sections.original: Go, leave, totter!
sections.spanish: ¡Vete, márchate, tambalea!

sections.original: Fare well! - with joy I came,
sections.spanish: ¡Adiós! – llegué con alegría,

sections.original: Until ye dwindlest.
sections.spanish: hasta que os marchitasteis.

sections.original: With rue I leave
sections.spanish: Con pesar me voy

sections.original: A morsel, nay more,
sections.spanish: con un bocado, no, más aún,

sections.original: Even the orb cannot
sections.spanish: ni siquiera el orbe puede

sections.original: For thy journey
sections.spanish: para tu viaje

sections.original: Help me melt the ice?!
sections.spanish: ¿ayúdame a derretir el hielo?!

sections.original: Hither and thither!
sections.spanish: ¡de aquí para allá!

sections.original: Hap mirthfulness! - Oh! joy of grand riddance;
sections.spanish: ¡Dicha plena! – ¡Oh, gozo de gran liberación;

sections.original: Undress me my hauberk! - the wyern hath errant'd.
sections.spanish: Desnúdame mi cota de malla – el dragón ha vagado.

sections.original: Ire of yore - bard of e'eryears -
sections.spanish: Ira de antaño – bardo de todos los tiempos –

sections.original: I deem the brood hath wan'd -
sections.spanish: opino que la progenie ha menguado –

sections.original: fore'ermore?!
sections.spanish: ¿¡para siempre?!

sections.original: Fro the chasm of the bosom, bale a hand back.
sections.spanish: Desde el abismo del pecho, retira una mano.

sections.original: Hark! my dove - henceforth I bulwark thee! -
sections.spanish: ¡Escucha! mi paloma – dorénavant te protegeré –

sections.original: Teathers of swans in my pillow - I cede my heart.
sections.spanish: Plumas de cisnes en mi almohada – cedo mi corazón.

sections.original: Make haste! - I pray - respond my plea!
sections.spanish: ¡Date prisa! – te ruego – responde a mi súplica!

sections.original: Lo! - a sire of great awe - a knight of many battles!
sections.spanish: ¡Mira! – un señor de gran respeto – un caballero de mil batallas!

sections.original: ...And of kinsmen weeping for the slain!
sections.spanish: ...¡Y parientes llorando por los caídos!

sections.original: Please! - heed my words;
sections.spanish: ¡Por favor! – atiende mis palabras;

sections.original: In thy sorrow I will kiss thy tears -
sections.spanish: en tu dolor besaré tus lágrimas –

sections.original: In thy bliss I will take thee by thy hand -
sections.spanish: en tu dicha tomaré tu mano –

sections.original: The sapor of grapes thou shalt savor -
sections.spanish: saborearás el sabor de las uvas –

sections.original: And harken the nighttingale sing oh so blithely!
sections.spanish: y escucharás al ruiseñor cantar con tanta alegría!

sections.original: On his knees... A plea to harvest roses;
sections.spanish: De rodillas... una súplica para cosechar rosas;

sections.original: No heed for the thorns you count!
sections.spanish: ¡Sin reparar en las espinas que cuentas!

sections.original: Wherefore vow me?
sections.spanish: ¿Por qué prometerme?

sections.original: Wherefor this gilded proffer?
sections.spanish: ¿Para qué esta ofrenda dorada?

sections.original: Wherefore not pay court to a maid more fair? -
sections.spanish: ¿Por qué no cortejar a una doncella más bella? –

sections.original: Morn of a joyous day! Hower 'twixt weed!
sections.spanish: ¡Mañana de un día gozoso! ¡Entre las malas hierbas!

sections.original: Fertile desert! Cheerful dirge!
sections.spanish: ¡Desierto fértil! ¡Cántico alegre!

sections.original: Misery me not! - man nor beast; envy me;
sections.spanish: ¡No me des miseria! – ni hombre ni bestia; envidiadme;

sections.original: Lest'tis an act of wont!
sections.spanish: ¡No sea costumbre!

sections.original: Many are the drapes that my past bury -
sections.spanish: Muchas son las sombras que entierra mi pasado –

sections.original: Ineffable feeling indulgeth in battles!
sections.spanish: ¡Un sentimiento inefable se recrea en las batallas!

sections.original: Tisn't what thou vambrace'st thy words with!!;
sections.spanish: ¡No es con lo que forjas tus palabras!

sections.original: I bethink dotingly only thy weal -
sections.spanish: Solo pondero con cariño tu bienestar –

sections.original: Forgive me for deeming thee direfully -
sections.spanish: Perdóname por considerarte funestamente –

sections.original: Therein abdiding with thee
sections.spanish: Allí, permaneciendo contigo

sections.original: Yet I was a trifle daunt'd.
sections.spanish: Sin embargo, estaba un poco intimidado.

sections.original: Is for me the grandest boon!
sections.spanish: ¡Es para mí el más grandioso don!

title.original: To These Words I Beheld No Tongue
title.spanish: Ante estas palabras no hallé lengua

sections.original: Whether the throned Monarch weareth the crown,
sections.spanish: Si el Monarca entronado porta la corona,

sections.original: Which I know not whether to his belongeth;
sections.spanish: cosa que ignoro si le pertenece;

sections.original: Doth he hence the sceptre sway?
sections.spanish: ¿Maneja él el cetro desde entonces?

sections.original: Seasoneth he justice? -
sections.spanish: ¿Administra justicia? –

sections.original: Daresay I he doth not,
sections.spanish: Diría que no lo hace,

sections.original: Will he then use his sceptre as a wand? -
sections.spanish: ¿Usará entonces su cetro como una varita? –

sections.original: Where doth sit my awe? - Trieth me conjure;
sections.spanish: ¿Dónde reposa mi asombro? – intenta conjurarme;

sections.original: Perchance a spell?; a reptile, a sullied hound? -
sections.spanish: ¿Quizá un hechizo?; ¿un reptil, un sabueso manchado? –

sections.original: Is the gentle rain a quality of his? -
sections.spanish: ¿Es la suave lluvia una de sus virtudes? –

sections.original: I bethink this fro my thoughts; hitherto, about this,
sections.spanish: Reflexiono esto en mi mente; hasta ahora, sobre ello,

sections.original: I beheld to these words no tongue; are the
sections.spanish: no hallé lengua ante estas palabras; ¿son

sections.original: Monarch's men his thralls or his servants? -
sections.spanish: vasallos o sirvientes los hombres del Monarca? –

sections.original: Oft I waylay my tongue -
sections.spanish: A menudo detengo mi lengua –

sections.original: Those of which are withal by my gnarled heart not heed'd;
sections.spanish: cuyas voces mi corazón retorcido no atiende;

sections.original: Or doth the throstle sing with more glee
sections.spanish: ¿O canta el tordo con más alegría

sections.original: At daybreak than than a twilight? -
sections.spanish: al amanecer que al anochecer? –

sections.original: Brawl not my imp, nor my cherub; reserve my judgement -
sections.spanish: No disputes, diablillo ni querubín; reserva mi juicio –

sections.original: Crave not the sword when the bodkin fro ere thine is;
sections.spanish: No anheles la espada cuando el punzón te precede;

sections.original: That undiscover'd country; be that
sections.spanish: Esa patria inexplorada; sea la de

sections.original: Of calamity, be that of joy, be that of apathy;
sections.spanish: calamidad, sea de gozo, sea de apatía;

sections.original: Tread not paths of new when those of old are
sections.spanish: No pises caminos nuevos cuando los antiguos están

sections.original: Far by an only single footstep; walk, be it
sections.spanish: lejos con un solo paso; camina, sea

sections.original: On the left, on the right - be it the one which
sections.spanish: a la izquierda, a la derecha – sea aquel que

sections.original: Straight forward leadeth; the one of correct
sections.spanish: lleva recto adelante; el del camino correcto

sections.original: I have as until now not heed'd any signs of!
sections.spanish: al cual, hasta ahora, no he prestado atención a ninguna señal!

sections.original: Filthy harlots - the Lord's grape!
sections.spanish: Rameras impuras – ¡el vino del Señor!

sections.original: With lore ornamented entreating;
sections.spanish: Con sabiduría ornamentada suplican;

sections.original: Hollow hearted, heart-departed -
sections.spanish: Corazón hueco, corazón apartado –

sections.original: Yet thou reapest the blooming rose -
sections.spanish: sin embargo, siegas la rosa floreciente –

sections.original: When 'tis the weed which is to be swath'd
sections.spanish: cuando es la maleza la que debe segarse

sections.original: I do, in the blooming flower, pleasure
sections.spanish: Encuentro placer en la flor en pleno auge

sections.original: find!
sections.spanish: ¡encuentro!

sections.original: And me in the yesterday's bind?!
sections.spanish: ¿Y yo atado a las ataduras de ayer?

sections.original: Innocence is reserved for the meek:
sections.spanish: La inocencia está reservada para los mansos:

sections.original: Of naught is my grasp ne'er to be!
sections.spanish: ¡Nada es lo que mi alcance nunca será!

sections.original: Hah! - for thee even a hound holdeth the throne.
sections.spanish: ¡Ja! – para ti incluso un sabueso ostenta el trono.

sections.original: Unwanted child of mother! - Plague of plagues!
sections.spanish: ¡Hijo no deseado de madre! – ¡Plaga de plagas!

sections.original: Father of leprous children.
sections.spanish: Padre de hijos leprosos.

sections.original: I wield ye to stint this brawl!
sections.spanish: ¡Los empuño para frenar esta contienda!

sections.original: Nigh is the ford - yet harken! - do not thwart!
sections.spanish: Cerca está el vado – ¡oye! – ¡no lo impidas!

sections.original: Desirest thou to do it withal,
sections.spanish: ¿Deseas hacerlo al mismo tiempo,

sections.original: I shall cause thy body by one head too short!
sections.spanish: haré que tu cuerpo carezca de una cabeza!

sections.original: Sayest ye nay to my boon;
sections.spanish: Si dices que no a mi favor;

sections.original: Then wilt thou from bloodshed swoon!
sections.spanish: ¡entonces desmayarás por el derramamiento de sangre!

sections.original: Err me not! - Must ye bethink my foolhardiness!
sections.spanish: ¡No me equivoques! – ¿Debes considerar mi temeridad?

sections.original: Be vanished! - Be banished! -
sections.spanish: ¡Desaparece! – ¡Sé desterrado! –

sections.original: If ye deemest me not wroth.
sections.spanish: si no me consideras iracundo.

sections.original: My hand hieth to unsheathe the sword
sections.spanish: Mi mano se alza para desenvainar la espada

sections.original: Lest thou dost totter -
sections.spanish: por si tambaleas –

sections.original: Whid along! - Wherefore irk my haughtiness?
sections.spanish: ¡Sigue, pues! – ¿por qué irritar mi altivez?

sections.original: No man... No man at all!,
sections.spanish: ¡Ningún hombre... ningún hombre en absoluto!

sections.original: Wherefore bereave
sections.spanish: ¿Por qué despojar

sections.original: Be it lord or beggar
sections.spanish: asea señor o mendigo

sections.original: The kine of the sward?
sections.spanish: a las reses del pasto?

sections.original: Bereaveth my dignity!
sections.spanish: ¡Despoja mi dignidad!

sections.original: Wherefore holdest thou for
sections.spanish: ¿Por qué guardas para

sections.original: Me such a quality scowl?
sections.spanish: mimí una mirada tan hosca?

sections.original: Loom my darling sun -
sections.spanish: ¡Surge, mi querido sol –

sections.original: Bear the scarlet colour!
sections.spanish: luce el color carmesí!

sections.original: Come in out of the rain thou sayest - but thou ne'er step'st aside;
sections.spanish: «Entra, fuera de la lluvia», dices – pero nunca te apartas;

sections.original: And I am trapp'd -
sections.spanish: y yo estoy atrapado –

sections.original: A distance there is...
sections.spanish: existe una distancia...

sections.original: None, save me and the bodkin - pitter-patter on the roof:
sections.spanish: Nadie, salvo yo y el puñal – golpeteo en el tejado:

sections.original: Behold! - 'tis not the rain; thence me it has to be -
sections.spanish: ¡Mira! – no es la lluvia; de ahí debe ser para mí –

sections.original: I will not drink thy vintage wine, my dear;
sections.spanish: No beberé tu vino añejo, querida;

sections.original: Thou hast heed'd that I am of innocence, yet thou let'st thy lass into peril -
sections.spanish: Has observado que soy inocente, sin embargo pones en peligro a tu doncella –

sections.original: Thou let'st me be parched;
sections.spanish: me dejas sediento;

sections.original: My heart is of frailty, my pale skin is hued damask.
sections.spanish: Mi corazón es frágil, mi piel pálida teñida de damasco.

sections.original: When thou thy tears hast hidden, "Come back!", thou sayest -
sections.spanish: Cuando ocultas tus lágrimas, «¡Vuelve!», dices –

sections.original: There I soon am to be - but how am I to run when my bones, my heart!
sections.spanish: Allí pronto debo estar – ¡pero cómo correr cuando mis huesos, mi corazón!

sections.original: Thou hast me bereaft! -
sections.spanish: ¡Me has despojado!

sections.original: But run thou sayest; I run -
sections.spanish: Pero dices que corra; corro –

sections.original: And there and then I behold that a time will come when I again dead will be.
sections.spanish: y entonces me doy cuenta de que llegará el momento en que volveré a morir.

sections.original: Thou tell'st me to leave without delay -
sections.spanish: Me dices que me marche sin demora –

sections.original: I leave with my bodkin and my tears in my hands;
sections.spanish: me voy con mi puñal y mis lágrimas en las manos;

sections.original: Lo! - the shadows, the sky - descending;
sections.spanish: ¡Mira! – las sombras, el cielo – descendiendo;

sections.original: So by a dint of smite I gait ere I run and melt together with dusk.
sections.spanish: Así, por un golpe de azar, camino antes de correr y me uno al crepúsculo.

sections.original: In my mind in which is this event,
sections.spanish: En mi mente, donde yace este suceso,

sections.original: But it seems as if naught is to change anyway?!
sections.spanish: ¿pero parece que nada cambiará de todos modos?!

sections.original: After all these years thou left'st me down in the emotional depths -
sections.spanish: Tras todos estos años me abandonaste en las profundidades emocionales –

sections.original: The sombre soaked velvet-drape is hung upon me,
sections.spanish: Se ha colgado sobre mí el terciopelo empapado de sombras,

sections.original: Turning my feelings away from our so ignorant world:
sections.spanish: apartando mis sentimientos de nuestro mundo tan ignorante:

sections.original: All the beatiful moments shared, deliberatlely push'd aside -
sections.spanish: todos los hermosos momentos compartidos, deliberadamente relegados –

sections.original: ...a distance there is...
sections.spanish: ...existe una distancia...

sections.original: Stay still patient; wilt thou my sister of merciful troth be?
sections.spanish: Permanece paciente; ¿serás mi hermana de misericordiosa lealtad?

sections.original: I shall attempt the halter of thy life make less lighten'd!
sections.spanish: ¡Intentaré aliviar el yugo de tu vida!

sections.original: I shall climb the yew,
sections.spanish: Escalaré el tejo,

sections.original: Will it subdue me or not!
sections.spanish: ¿me someterá o no?

sections.original: Swooning emotions smite my bosom -
sections.spanish: Emociones que causan desmayo golpean mi pecho –

sections.original: I have in aptness depriev'd thy eyrie
sections.spanish: he privado con destreza tu nido,

sections.original: Oh! - but ne'er alas;
sections.spanish: ¡Oh! – pero nunca, ¡ay!;

sections.original: Fro many another a lass -
sections.spanish: De entre muchas doncellas –

sections.original: Lodge here fore'ermore.
sections.spanish: alójate aquí por siempre.

sections.original: Dodge thither sable of yore!
sections.spanish: ¡Escapa hacia las tinieblas de antaño!

sections.original: A narrow dell hath now for me turn'd into a broad land;
sections.spanish: Un valle estrecho se ha convertido para mí en tierra extensa;

sections.original: A land rich with fields of the Simbelmyne.
sections.spanish: una tierra rica en campos de simbelmina.

sections.original: Sonorous to my ears are the words form'd by thy tongue;
sections.spanish: Resuenan en mis oídos las palabras de tu lengua;

sections.original: Conquer me! - Waylay me! - Swathe me 'twixt thy arms!
sections.spanish: ¡Conquístateme! – ¡Embosca mis sentidos! – ¡Envuélveme entre tus brazos!

sections.original: Make me sense the wine which is drunk by queens,
sections.spanish: Hazme sentir el vino que beben las reinas,

sections.original: And let it flow white and full in tast o'er my lips.
sections.spanish: y déjalo fluir blanco y pleno en sabor sobre mis labios.

sections.original: Make me sense the wine which is drunk by kings,
sections.spanish: Hazme sentir el vino que beben los reyes,

sections.original: And let it flow red and full in taste o'er my lips.
sections.spanish: y déjalo fluir rojo y pleno en sabor sobre mis labios.

sections.original: A dais'd bridge o'er the ghyll,
sections.spanish: Un puente cubierto de margaritas sobre el torrente,

sections.original: In which a river bottomless -
sections.spanish: en el que un río inabarcable –

sections.original: I would have drowned,
sections.spanish: me habría ahogado,

sections.original: Yet thou drewest me out soaking!
sections.spanish: ¡sin embargo, me rescataste empapado!

sections.original: Save thou art not yet all parched -
sections.spanish: A menos que aún no estés totalmente reseco –

sections.original: Eavesdroppest ye: A wee drop,
sections.spanish: ¿Escuchas? – una gota diminuta,

sections.original: I can hear it! - I can feel it!
sections.spanish: ¡La oigo! – ¡La siento!

sections.original: Whence it comes I can only deem,
sections.spanish: No sé de dónde procede,

sections.original: Yet I will not tarry idly!
sections.spanish: ¡pero no me quedaré inerte!

sections.original: Lest this for me is a gay dream:
sections.spanish: No sea que para mí esto sea un sueño encantador:

sections.original: Let it adamant be -
sections.spanish: que sea inquebrantable –

sections.original: A dream that will sojourn eternally -
sections.spanish: un sueño que morará eternamente –

sections.original: Empty the flagon in me!
sections.spanish: ¡Vacía la jarra en mi interior!

sections.original: In which theatre I will act!
sections.spanish: ¡en cuyo teatro actuaré!

sections.original: Harken! - the clouds mustered in dark -
sections.spanish: ¡Escucha! – las nubes se agruparon en la oscuridad –

sections.original: So painfully easing.
sections.spanish: aliviando con dolor.

sections.original: Hush! - hearest ye the yew doting;
sections.spanish: ¡Silencio! – ¿oyes el tejo deleitarse?;

sections.original: Its years of yore in a mire,
sections.spanish: sus años de antaño en el cieno,

sections.original: Each like a corpse within its grave;
sections.spanish: cada uno como un cadáver en su tumba;

sections.original: Wrought for us a yearn of lief;
sections.spanish: forjó en nosotros un anhelo de vida;

sections.original: Tis not a lore of bale nor loathe;
sections.spanish: no es una historia de aflicción ni de odio;

sections.original: Harmony and aesthesia are its blisses;
sections.spanish: armonía y sensibilidad son sus dichas;

sections.original: Ne'er ere hath it exist'd so sonorously -
sections.spanish: nunca antes existió con tal sonoridad –

sections.original: Jostl'd away the pale drape
sections.spanish: desplazó el pálido velo

sections.original: That us had been o'erhung -
sections.spanish: que nos había cubierto –

sections.original: Tempt'd thy shutters to open
sections.spanish: tentó tus contraventanas a abrirse

sections.original: And thus quench'd the hearth;
sections.spanish: y así apagó el hogar;

sections.original: Thou giv'st to misery all thou hast: the cold -
sections.spanish: entregas a la miseria todo lo que posees: el frío –

sections.original: With weal embrac'd the sprounting landscape
sections.spanish: abraza con dicha el paisaje germinante

sections.original: Like a star of heaven in the broad daylight -
sections.spanish: como una estrella en pleno día –

sections.original: This joy subdueth until it again waneth,
sections.spanish: esta alegría se subyuga hasta menguar de nuevo,

sections.original: Save the drooping winter of stalwart.
sections.spanish: salvo el invierno fatigado del robusto.

sections.original: Now as I am to be bereaft of my troth
sections.spanish: Ahora, al ser despojado de mi lealtad

sections.original: I cry aloud my last words of lost hope.
sections.spanish: clamo en voz alta mis últimas palabras de esperanza perdida.

sections.original: A violent gust of wind is my frame of mind;
sections.spanish: una ráfaga violenta es mi estado de ánimo;

sections.original: Huxes like moisture through pores.
sections.spanish: se filtra como humedad por mis poros.

sections.original: I am unwilling to forgive
sections.spanish: No estoy dispuesto a perdonar

sections.original: Him who depriev'd me of my life -
sections.spanish: a quien me arrebató la vida –

sections.original: Gloaming the sequence -
sections.spanish: ombreando la secuencia –

sections.original: A momentary view.
sections.spanish: una visión momentánea.

sections.original: Perishing intervals of rejoice -
sections.spanish: intervalos de júbilo perecederos –

sections.original: My supreme happiness is lost!
sections.spanish: ¡mi suprema felicidad se ha perdido!

sections.original: Baleful emotions of fear - my body is the earth -
sections.spanish: Emociones funestas de miedo – mi cuerpo es la tierra –

sections.original: The earth is now destined to be made forlorn -
sections.spanish: la tierra está destinada a volverse desolada –

sections.original: Forlorn from the enlivening energies.
sections.spanish: despojada de las energías que la animan.

sections.original: Am I not anylonger living?
sections.spanish: ¿Acaso ya no estoy vivo?

sections.original: In mournful silence I suffer -
sections.spanish: En silencio lúgubre sufro –

sections.original: In peace I now will rest.
sections.spanish: en paz ahora descansaré.

sections.original: My hard-working hands
sections.spanish: Mis manos laboriosas

sections.original: Are now reposed.
sections.spanish: ahora reposan.

sections.original: I close thee my beloved into my heart -
sections.spanish: Te cierro, amado mío, en mi corazón –

sections.original: Conceal thy memory in my inner sanctum.
sections.spanish: oculta tu recuerdo en mi santuario interno.

sections.original: In my thoughts thou shalt forever be -
sections.spanish: En mis pensamientos permanecerás por siempre –

sections.original: As a dear and precious remembrance.
sections.spanish: como un recuerdo querido y precioso.

sections.original: I'm dethroned in the reign of entity -
sections.spanish: Estoy destronado en el reino del ser –

sections.original: My tears descend like of abony -
sections.spanish: mis lágrimas caen como ébano –

sections.original: Life is the theatre of tragedy -
sections.spanish: la vida es el teatro de la tragedia –

sections.original: Dying - I only feel apathy!
sections.spanish: Muriendo – ¡solo siento apatía!
